tasks.task: Inspect and analyze a combine harvester after harvesting.
subtasks: Approach the combine harvester from the back.
Open the ventilation gaps to check for residue and ensure proper airflow.
Examine the cutting mechanism for any clogs or damage.
Check the auger for obstructions or wear.
Inspect the combine's chaffer (grain tank) for collectability of grain and remove any debris or lodged material.
Assess the condition of the plates around the grain tank to prevent grain from spilling.
Lubricate moving parts to prevent future issues.
Clean the combine's screen sections to improve performance.

tasks.task: Adjust the combine harvester's settings for optimal grain harvesting.
subtasks: Determine the proper feed rate based on crop type and moisture content.
Set the proper speed of the combine harvester to match field conditions.
Adjust the reel speed and height to catch ripe grain effectively.
Fine-tune the draper belt orlevator speed to prevent combines losses or bridging.
Calibrate the combine's header lift mechanism for timely operation.
Check the fan speed and air intake of the combine harvester to ensure efficient cleaning.

tasks.task: Load grain onto a wagon or trailer using a combine harvester.
subtasks: Position the combine harvester near the wagon or trailer to facilitate loading.
Turn on the combine's unloading system (elevator or auger) to move grain into the wagon.
Monitor grain flow and adjust combine speed or unloading system as needed.
Ensure the wagon or trailer stays within its capacity limits.
Avoid overloading the wagon or trailer to prevent accidents or structural damage.

tasks.task: Adjust the grain combine for optimal performance during operation.
subtasks: Check the proper tension on the harvested grain stall to prevent slippage.
Evaluate the bottom chain's alignment and tension to ensure smooth operation.
Inspect the combine's field monitor settings to adjust settings during harvest.
Clean or replace the combine's filters to maintain good airflow and performance.

tasks.task: Refuel and inspect the fuel system of a combine harvester.
subtasks: Locate the fuel tank on the combine harvester.
Open the fuel valves to check for leaks or proper flow.
Add diesel fuel to the tank as needed, ensuring it meets the correct grade specified in the combine's manual.
Inspect fuel lines and connections for damage or blockages.
Replace any fuel filters or regulators if necessary.
Check the fuel pump's operation to ensure reliable starting.
Test the spark plugs of the combine's engine if necessary, and replace them if they are worn.
Ensure the fuel injection system is functioning properly to avoid issues during operation.

tasks.task: Prepare a combine harvester for overnight storage after a day of harvesting.
subtasks: Drain any excess fuel from the fuel tank to avoid residues.
Lubricate the hydraulic systems to prevent rust and wear.
Cover sensitive components like the engine and cab to protect from the elements.
Disconnect electrical connections to prevent moisture damage.
Adjust the header to a safe position if left unattended overnight.

tasks.task: Maintain proper grain flow through the combine harvester during harvesting.
subtasks: Check for any grain lodged in the auger or elevator.
Clear grain blockages by stopping the combine and safely dislodging obstructions.
Replace worn auger flights if necessary.
Check the auger alignment and clearances with the housing.
Clean the combine's grain tank and discharge auger after harvest to prevent mold or pest buildup.

tasks.task: Use a combination of operational checks and maintenance tasks to ensure a combine harvester is ready for the next day's work.
subtasks: Perform pre-trip checks on the combine harvester to ensure all systems are functional.
Inspect the tires for proper inflation and wear, adjusting as necessary.
Check chains (if equipped) for proper tension and lubrication.
Tighten loose bolts or connections on the combine harvester.
